subject: Art & Design
title: Cropping and Aspect Ratio: Shaping the Story
description: A 60-second lesson on Cropping and Aspect Ratio: Shaping the Story.

hook.text: The same photo cropped square feels modern. Cropped 16:9 feels cinematic. The frame shapes the mood.

buildup.text: Aspect ratio is the width-to-height proportion of an image: 3:2, 4:3, 16:9, 1:1 ‚Äî each tells a different story.

discovery.text: Cropping removes distractions and tightens composition. It's the most underused editing tool.

twist.text: Cartier-Bresson never cropped. But Ansel Adams cropped freely. Neither was wrong ‚Äî intent matters.

climax.text: Instagram popularized the square (1:1). TikTok popularized 9:16. Platform shapes composition choices.

punchline.text: The crop is the last composition decision. Make it count.

quiz.question: Why is cropping a powerful composition tool?
options: It removes distractions and tightens the visual story
